condition: My teen told me that something serious happened to them and I did not know how to handle it
condition_name: My teen told me that something serio
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Praise @fields.child_nickname for telling you, that is not easy to do! Remember, you can use all the skills you collected in your toolbox: Take a Pause, reassure @fields.child_nickname that you are here for them, discuss possible solutions, and reach out to get the support you and @fields.child_nickname need!

It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Praise your teen for telling you, that is not easy to do! Remember, you can use all the skills you collected in your toolbox: Take a Pause, reassure your teen that you are here for them, discuss possible solutions, and reach out to get the support you and your teen need!

condition: The conversation made me very uncomfortable because I was reminded of something serious that happened to me
condition_name: The conversation made me very uncomf
message_text: When we are reminded of such situations, it is normal to feel upset or angry . It is important to find a time when you are calm, so you can think of what support you need: You may need to talk to someone.

condition: My teen, or me, or my family did not feel comfortable
condition_name: My teen, or me, or my family did not
message_text: It is completely normal to experience this challenge, this is difficult stuff to talk about. Find a calm time. You can say that we hope these things never happen, but it’s like getting insurance – it's best to think about them and be prepared.

condition: My teen did not discuss anything sensitive or challenging with me

message_text: @fields.child_nickname

That's okay! The important thing is that @fields.child_nickname knows that you are here for them. It sometimes takes time for a teen to feel comfortable sharing. Try to keep an open channel of communication with them by spending quality time together and accepting their ideas.
